content.detailedDescription:
Was watching town fireworks display at approximately 9 pm and noticed this very bright object that was definitely not fireworks related. it had a flight path and came in from the west and circled the area, then flew back toward the west and i observed it until it was out of sight.
it was circular in shape, although not a perfect circle. it glowed a very bright orange which pulsated to a very bright red aura around it.
i did not mention it to anyone else because i was afraid that they would think i saw fireworks and was mistaken.
content.summary: While watching fireworks noticed object come from west and circle area, then return to west and fly out of sight. was very bright orange and pulsated bright red. was circuler in shape.

content.detailedDescription: It was last night (july 4th) and i had just came home from work. it was approximately 10:18. i walked into my house, which sits behind my moms house. i walked in and was looking to the east because i could hear fireworks. didn't see anything. walked into the house, set my keys down and my other work stuff then walked back outside. looked toward the east again. a big orange ball appeared over the building next door to my house. it just appeared. if it had been following a path, i would have seen it. ran back inside and grabbed my cellphone. started filming at 10:21pm. the ball seemed close to me but also far away, if that makes sense. there was no noise. it travelled directly over my house then over the golf course behind me and disappeared. it didn't seem to travel upward but got smaller and smaller and disappeared. i stood there for a minute or so scanning the sky. in the southeast, i saw six orange balls about a half mile or so away. all like what i had just witnessed but smaller. they were in a straight line, seemed to come together (almost forming two triangles) then disappeared. i went and got my dog and came back outside. a few minutes later, i saw another orange ball appear in the same spot as the first one. it travelled the same path as the first and disappeared in the same spot. i know it was july fourth and everyone has been teasing me (except one friend from another town who witnessed the exact same thing a couple months ago in a town over an hour away) but this was not fireworks and not a plane. between the small fireworks being set off (we did not have a fireworks show here in my small town), there was absolutely no noise. this was so close i should have heard something. i am one of the biggest skeptics you will meet when it comes to ufos but this was unexplainable. i was fascinated yet creeped out all at the same time. i stayed outside another 10-15 minutes but saw nothing else. i did get crappy cellphone video of the two orbs that travelled over my house but the six smaller ones did not show up on my video
content.summary: Saw bright orangish orb appear out of nowhere. traveled extremely slow. saw 6 more to the west a few minutes later then another one following same path as first

content.detailedDescription:
We had just arrived home from attending a fireworks display. my husband carried our son inside, and i was taking some blankets out of the back of our suv.  for some reason, i looked up at the sky and saw one large red/orange orb floating through the sky coming from the left.  at first, i thought it was fireworks, but the light didn't go away.  it would glide through the sky, hover for a few seconds, then change directions slightly and move again.  then, the light grew larger and very bright, and darted across the sky (to the right).  i then noticed there was a second orb that behaved like the first.

i watched the lights for about five to ten minutes, then they took off and i lost sight of them.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Two red/orange orbs in sky during 4th of july that hovered and changed direction.

content.detailedDescription: We were parked off the east of dick's sporting goods park.  fireworks were seen around the city.  someone in our group pointed out the lights.  the more we looked at them, the more we knew they were not fireworks or planes and helicopters.  the lights were hovering and flying around each other for about three minutes.  they were disappearing and reappearing randomly.  the lights looked to be hovering over the rocky mountain arsenal area.  several people in our group filmed the lights with their camera phones.  the lights faded away one by one.  other people who were there at the park were tweeting about it and pictures/videos were posted on instagram.  when we got home, our cell phones would not work.  we felt shocked and surprised.
content.summary: There were about 4 lights in the distance hovering and flying around each other for about 3 minutes.

content.detailedDescription: We were sitting out on the deck. the area is quite dark and not much ambient light. at first when it appeared we thought it was a firework since it was the 4th. when the object didn't burn out we realized that it wasn't a firework at all. it started as a "fireball" glowing like a flare. then as i followed it behind some trees and the trees blocked the glowing part i could see the actual craft that was much larger then the glowing part. the glowing part was near the front of the craft. the craft was a dull grayish in color with no other lights and emitted no noise. i then lost the object behind the trees as it continued its northerly path. then at 10pm it was back. again coming from the south heading due north but a little higher in the sky this time. we're not sure is this was the same one we saw at 9 or a second one. the "flare like" glow was identical but the night sky was much darker so this time we couldn't see the actual craft. if i didn't see the actual craft the first time i would have thought that the glow was the craft whe in fact the craft itself was much, much larger. i was able to capture 2 photos and a minute of video before we lost sight of it in the distance.
content.summary: Looked like a flare but didn't burn out. then i was able to see grayish disk type craft.

content.detailedDescription: Came home after works saw it from my driveway
content.summary: Red yellow light

content.detailedDescription: On the evening of july 4th 2013, as we watched fireworks from our windows we observed a row of lights over ann arbor as planes flew by and fireworks were on display. lights were 9 in total and were in a curved vertical line, red and orange, stationary and not blinking. gradually lights disappeared as if they were being turned off until one was left for a 1/2 minute then all were gone.
content.summary: Ufo seen 7/4/2013

content.detailedDescription:
We were on the deck at home at about 9:39 pm july 4 2013
we were watching fireworks to the east and saw red orb cross the sky over head
we thought it was strange
they were redish and white glowing orbs that flew across the sky
thought they were strange
lost as they keep going north
content.summary: Red orbs 6 or 7 flying south to north high in sky,i have video

content.altitude: 500 Feet or Less, Over 500 Feet (no cloudcover)
content.detailedDescription: I witnessed eight objects that i would call a ufo.  all were like flying lanterns, like fire glowing in the sky moving at high speed.  appeared while there were fireworks going off. i observed these lights for over an hour.  i also have video of the  event(s).  i was at first skeptical as to what these objects were.  one of the first i witnessed, the light began to pulsate closer to the town of arnold, mo.  the light then went out and in the light of dusk, i could make out the shape of the craft.  it resembled a turtle shell and from the distance i would say that the craft was very large.  i was able to make out two craft as such, and was also able to see the shape of a craft as it passed over my home without lights.  the lights turned off, and i was able to make out the same shape of a large craft that physically blocked out the night sky.  i have seen things like this in my life, but never in this detail.  i also believe that i also saw one of these craft on the date of july 3, 2013.  the craft that day was exactly the same as on july 4th in description but only with the fire like appearance.  as i have mentioned, i do have video of the craft(s) with and without lights.  it was an amazing event and i plan to monitor the sky above my home for further evidence.  if someone would like to contact me to view these videos or to interview myself,  i am more than happy.  the second witness to most of this sighting was my 6 year old son, he saw them as flying lanterns and was quite helpful in pointing them out.  the first sighting on july 3, 2013 had four adult witnesses including myself.  i do not currently have access to these videos, but i will upload them at your request.
content.summary: Looked like fire flying through the sky.  when closer to town, lights turned off and was able to see craft.

content.detailedDescription:
We were all sitting outside to watch fireworks because it was the 4th of july, and a friend and i were on a waterslide and saw this bright object. so we go and get out family and it was bright green flying north, then we pointed at it, and it started coming torwards us, and turned red. after a few seconds of watching it, the object turned neon blue, and split into 2 objects
 it only lasted for a few seconds before it returned into one big green and red object. my uncle syarted recording it but the video only came out as a tiny white ball thay gradually becomes larger as it flew over our house. once over the house we ran to thw front door, and within 2 seconds it was very far. so everyone but a few people went inside and as we were talking about it, we started hearing a weird peircing noise that gradually became louder and started to sound like soundwaves. it would go in one ear and out the other and it made us just sit their for a few seconds before we jumped up to get the rest of the family. once we all calmed down we went outiside at about 3 am. nothing more happened, but it was a very weird inncident! nobody of the people that experienced it really believed in aliens, but we are firm believers. now
content.summary: Greean and red lights the once it hovered over us it made a buzzing sound.

content.detailedDescription: My young child and i were leaving the moraine ohio fireworks displays around 10:25p.M. i drove down dryden rd. until i reached nicholas rd to turn left. the traffic light was red so we stopped. i told my child to look out her window we were on the small bridge and we can see people's fireworks. we saw a few fireworks going off when i noticed five balls of light that did not fade. i turned left when my traffic light turned green. i turned left and pulled off the road to the right on nicholas rd. the balls of reddish-pink light were still there. i watched the lights for several minutes. one off the objects kept moving back and forth between the other objects. finally 3 of the objects took off and flew over to the right a short ways and then flew straight up and disappeared in the sky in like 2-3 seconds. at that time i got back in my car and drove home in excitement and called my friends and family to see if anyone else has seen what i had seen.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: 4-5 redish-pink glowing objects hoovering over dayton during fireworks.

content.detailedDescription: On july 4th 2013, while observing distant fireworks with family on my deck in hackettstown nj, we noticed a very faint pinpoint of light passing overhead at an extremely high altitude at around 9:45pm est.  we noticed the light because every 15 - 20 seconds, it pulsated an extremely bright white light that lasted for 3 or 4 seconds which was almost too bright to look at.  the sighting lasted about 60 - 90 seconds as it passed over the house from the southeast, traveling at a moderate rate of speed in a straight line moving northwest until it disappeared.  i quickly grabbed my binoculars from right inside the door and observed a perfectly roundish oval shaped object that seemed internally lit with a faint white light that then flashed very bright white, so bright that i could not observe with the binoculars when it lit up.  there were no green or red navigation lights on the object as i normally observe on planes that frequently travel through the area.  additionally, the altitude of this object seemed extraordinarily high, and could almost barely be seen against the black sky when the light was not pulsing.  extremely unusual looking light as when the light pulsated it seemed very close to the ground, but when the light dimmed it looked to be thousands of feet in altitude.  we followed the object as it passed until it pulsated one last time and disappeared completely.  myself and my guests were all very amazed by what we observed as other planes in the sky at the time were clearly identifiable by navigation lights, sound and normal flight pattern/path.  this object we witnessed made no observable noise, was extremely high and pulsated an incredibly bright light that we were able to observe so far from the object.
content.summary: Faint light passing high overhead, pulsated very bright white light every 15 seconds then disappeard.

content.detailedDescription: Outside watching fireworks.  looked away from fireworks for a second or so then turned back toward the same sw direction and noticed very large red/orange ball shaped object with hazy outline heading straight toward me. no idea about identification but first impression was a stray bit of fireworks but speed was too slow and it had a flight path.  object was way too bright to be a plane/planet or anything that i had ever seen.  was moving at a steady pace/not very fast and about the altitude of a small plane.  appeared to possibly be pulsating but not sure about that.  it then took a wide left turn, maintaining the same speed.  once this was accomplished, it began to fade in and out then quickly disappeared from site.
content.summary: Large red/orange light moving slowly in my direction

content.detailedDescription: We were driving back from a 4th july pool party. we were pulling slowly into our house street and as we got out we noticed a bright orange glowing light in a starlight shape which ascended in straight line upwards. it shown brightly, remained stationary, not moving and then slowly moved up, then the light just faded. this took about 2 minutes. i can say this was not fireworks - we know the difference. my daughter took a picture from her phone (hope to download later). my older daughter and fianc���e were close behind in their car and also saw the light. we are mostly ex-military so we can confirm it didn't behave like a plane or helicopter. about 10 minutes later we heard a helicopter overhead. did anyone else see this?
content.summary: We saw a bright orange orb shining brightly then ascend and fade.

content.detailedDescription:
I was sitting at a fire the evening of june 30th, 2013 and was staring out at the southern sky. the stars had not been out long and i noticed three stars. they caught my eye because they were slightly brighter then the rest. i stared at them for a short time (aprox. 30 sec) while i was listening to some conversation and then the three stars faded out, like you would see if a cloud passed over them. i thought it was strange because it was a clear night so i remained focused on the spot in the sky where they were and noted the stars around the location. i waited for 2-3 minutes but they did not reappear nor was there any clouds moving in the area of the sky where they were. it was also strange that all three of these lights faded out at the same time. there was also no movement of the three lights while they were visible.

i grabbed my phone to check google sky map to see if there are any stars in the location of the three that i saw. from what it was showing, there are no visible stars in that location of the sky which would explain what i saw. all of the other stars that were visible after the sighting showed up on the google sky map app.

i grew up on a farm and have always had a fascination with the stars and have spent many hours of my life staring up at them. i've seen meteors, comets, the iss, satellites, planes and helicopters in the night sky and i have never seen anything like what i did that night.
content.summary: Three bright stars in triangle shape faded out of sight

content.detailedDescription:
I was outside about to start fireworks when i noticed a very bright red fireball slowly traveling in the sky. not a firework. it continued to glow beat red. my attention went to what i saw so i kept looking at it however it dimmed out and disappeared. 2 minutes later i caught another one through some trees (lots of trees where i am) i ran to try and get a better look to see if it was what i had just seen and there were two together moving across the sky. in kind of a pattern, slight direction changes viewed while visible. then other ones were visible in other directions spanning a good distance, like 1-2-3 miles apart?? hard to tell. they were all over but i never saw more than 4 at one time. they're real good at disappearing. as soon as the fireworks died down so did the sightings. although it felt as if they were still there, you just couldn't see them. (strange feeling)

this is three years in a row now that i have had sightings here on july 4th. i also have pics and video of all three years now. i feel like everyone thinks i'm a nut, but i know what i'm looking at. i got excited that they did come because i had expressed curiosity as to if they'd be here again. other friends and family members saw it also. last year scared the heck out of me and i reported it to nuforc and got no response from anyone. i wasn't as affected this time because it wasn't any more intense than the year prior. and the first year on july 4th i witnessed a ufo it was 1 black round or oval disc. no fireballs.

i'll expect them next year too. i just hope one day i have an answer to this mysterious fireball sighting. it's hard to imagine the government has no knowledge of this independence day visit. too many people are seeing them!
content.flightPath: Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Several red fireball objects 1st at 8:30 from east, then more appeared from different directions flying back and forth above puyallup south hill between meridian and waller rd.

content.detailedDescription:
I was standing on the balcony, which faces north.  i was on the phone with a friend of mine and had just stepped outside to have a cigarette while we talked.  it was july 4, so i had been scanning the horizon all night, looking over the city for fireworks, etc.

over the building across the street to the north of ours, i noted a bright red point of light.  it initially reminded me of a firework mortar that glows brightly as it flies into the air, and then disappears, usually just before exploding into a dazzling array.  this however, was moving eastward in the sky, at a slight upward angle.  it was glowing red, bright and intense.  as i tried to focus and pay attention to the detail, it seemed to be obscured by smoke or some form of vapor.  a secondary thought was that it was akin to seeing a rocket launch or afterburner takeoff, with a smoke/vapor trail, however, being night time, i could see no trail, only the illuminated cloud near the bright light.

as i watched, a white light would pulsate from the object as well, or perhaps it was changing color between red and white, back and forth.  but it was a pulse type color change, the each color was just as bright, and there was no discernible pattern of timing.  i attempted to use another cell phone to get video, but it was distant enough that i could not get a good view of it.

before it was to move out of my view, when it was just north, of northeast, it began a noticeable arc downward and faded out of sight.

there were no other witnesses that i am aware of.
content.summary: Red/white pulsating fireball over northern bakersfield

content.detailedDescription: Watching fireworks, noticed strange objects appearing over another apartment complex. they were appearing and then wouldnt for a couple of minutes. i was able to record a video and shoot a couple of pictures, but it was just weird. at one point a small does appear near them.
content.summary: While watching fireworks, strange objects started to appear and they were not fireworks

content.detailedDescription: July 4th, 2013 around 9:50 10:00 pm i was sitting on my deck with a friend.  i was looking up at the sky and saw an orange orb flying by.  i told my friend to look and she saw it. it was faster than an airplane and traveling north west.  we ran to an area without trees and could see the object was so far it was like the size of a star and then just flew too far for us to see it anymore.  i saw this orb a few years ago over lake meade in east berlin pa after the fireworks and around the same time. at first i didn't know what i was looking at.  then i knew it was an orb like i had seen years before. i think she was more surprised because she had never seen this before.  i don't know what they are but i think they like fireworks.
content.summary: Orange orb flying in one direction extremely fast after local fireworks.

content.detailedDescription: I was out on my lanai watching fireworks with my husband when we noticed a red-orange object flying. it out shined the fire works. at first we thought it was a space station, but i've seen them before and they were never that big or that color. the way it flew or floated resembled the flight path of one. it flew over us and continued on till we could no longer see it. we commented that it was going to fast for a plane, ha ha must be a ufo. meanwhile we were mesmerized by it and found ourselves ignoring the fireworks and staring at this orange thing flying. five minutes later, it did the exact same thing. now we know somethings "off", as nothing i know of can go around the earth that fast. no it did not just circle around like a helicopter, it flew horizon to horizon. it flew se-nw. didn't sleep well.
content.summary: Orange reddish glow moving across the sky, 2 times.

content.detailedDescription:
Driving home from friends - noticed a round orange light moving north.
at first thought it could be firework - but realized it was moving in steady line and not extinguishing. pulled over on road to get a better look.
i watched it for about 30 seconds had no idea what it could be. 
meteor? comet? flare attached to a balloon? 

i pulled back out onto the road and started driving again. i looked up and saw another one on same flight path as the first. i watched as it passed directly overhead. 
no sound, slowly moving - not very high up in the sky - glowing and orange.
content.summary: 2 glowing round orbs moving slowly north - no sound 7/4/2013

content.detailedDescription:
Working 3rd shift standing in the parking lot and looked to the south west appeared to be a bright basketball orange in color steadily streaking across the sky. the brightness remained the same no flashing just bright, no tail or sound . the direction of flight was steady and consistent. i viewed until the object traveled out of my sight. i did manage to capture a cell picture. 



mls
content.summary: While at work i observed a orange glowing object trailing across the sky.

content.detailedDescription:
I was at a friends house for the 4th of july we were all outside lighting fireworks when we notice these 5 lights in the sky 



the lights were bright and the way they were in the sky it was hard not to notice them then they slowly moving to the left then slowly went away

we were all a little lost to what it could be we knew it was not a plane or helicopter the 5 lights disappeared  but 2 of the lights came back that's when i stated taking video and picture when it came back and just hovered again we knew it had to be ufos


it started as 5 bright lights some would get brighter or start moving they were moving to the left slowly 


just glad me and my friends all saw it together it was easy to talk with all of them about what happened

they just slowly disappeared
content.flightPath: Stationary,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: 4th of july ufo

content.altitude: Over 500 Feet (under cloudcover), Over 500 Feet (no cloudcover)
content.detailedDescription: Came out onto deck for a smoke at 12:30 am before bed. looking out to the north, saw a bright red-orange/yellow-orange object moving slowly in my general direction. as my daughter and i watch the skies frequently and she was inside, i called her out to see what i was looking at. she was outside within 30 seconds by which time a second object was also in the sky, following the same basic line of flight. just as the first object was about to go out of our view - behind a tree to the ne - a third object appeared in the northern spot from which the first two had originated. so there were three objects viewable in the sky at the same time. this was from 12:33 to 12:36. we viewed the objects both with the naked eye and with binoculars. the best way to describe the objects is to say they were egg like (without the shell). the "whites" of the eggs were approximately one and a half times larger than the "yolks" and the yolks were the light source of the objects and rotated in a similar fashion to police lights in that they seemed to spin in the bottom of the "egg" and illuminated brighter and dimmer as they spun. almost immediately after the third object went behind the tree in the ne which was the last point we could see them, a fourth one appeared in the northern sky from where the original three had originated. a second one followed suit before the fourth one was no longer viewable; there were two in our field of vision at this instance. about 2-3 minutes after the fifth one had gone behind the tree there was another, and approximately 4-5 minutes after the sixth there was a seventh. we had also seen a similar object west of our position at 10:45 pm (on the 4th of july) and (though we didn't really think so) concluded that, logically, it must have been a chinese lantern. it was moving way too fast for us to really believe that, but we didn't want to let our imaginations run away from us and we had not observed it intently with the binoculars. seeing the 7 others after midnight convinced us that the first/earlier object was one of the same types. the objects that we observed were moving very smoothly and relatively slowly through the sky, taking about 2 to 2.5 minutes apiece to move across our field of view; probably about 8 miles of travel total with the nearest point being a bit less than a mile away. the last object we saw was at 12:44 in the early morning of july the 5th.
content.summary: Line of 7 pulsing objects slowly moving from n to s over tigard, or

content.detailedDescription:
I was in the backyard moving stuff around and stood up to watch the fireworks for a second when i noticed 2 bright, reddish lights moving across my horizon facing the cascades from the lynnwood/everett area.  i immediately thought it was strange when both lights continued to streak instead of falling if they'd been fireworks.  

i followed the flight path through the tree line until both faded out of sight. the objects were too far away to see any details.  both objects had a continuous light unlike planes whose red lights pulse.  i then noticed 2 more objects with the exact same appearance following same trajectory as the first two but starting slightly more north.

they may have been military jets flying directly away from us, causing us to only view directly at the rear of the engine without the ability to see the trail.
content.summary: I also saw the lights previously reported from enumclaw.

content.detailedDescription: I was sitting in a lawn chair chatting with my cousin after we finished doing 4th of july fireworks in the driveway. we were chatting and listening to the bigger public fireworks in the distance which were mostly over by that time. we were on a hill and down the hill from us to the north was a really tall evergreen tree. i guess it was about 100 feet away. i noticed a yellow-gold light ascending behind it. i thought it was a firework on its way up before it exploded. that would have been unusual to have one of those launched kinds in the residential area but my cousins had said earlier that some of their neighbors shot off illegal ones last year that they must have bought out of state. i assumed that's what that was. it never exploded though and it just kept ascending. by this point, i had mentioned it to my cousin i was sitting with. he said, "yeah, that orange light? wonder what that is." we watched it ascend behind the tree but we had a pretty clear view as the evergreen was scraggly and had a lot of space between the branches. now, we're both watching it and i think it looked a little like a comet with a faint tail or maybe just teardrop-shaped. from where i was standing on the ground, the light traveled to above the top of that tree - so, you could draw a straight line from my eye to the top of the tree and up even more in that same line to the glowing object.  it turned 90-degrees and started traveling south in a straight line above us a little to our west. it was traveling toward the crest of the hill/butte that we were on. my cousin and i were discussing what we thought it might be. he had a strong green laser pointer in his pocket that his son had been playing with. he shined it at the object and joked that if that were an aircraft, what he was doing was illegal. i mentioned that i thought it was a firework ember floating across the sky. but, it would have gone out long before that, where was the rest of the firework and i realized that it was moving pretty fast. the light was dimmer then and continued to get dimmer as it moved on. by this point, his wife came out and noticed what we were looking at and watched it travel away until it was gone. she mentioned how strangely fast it was going. i was getting a bit concerned since i had no rational explanation as to what it was. i started to see a faint outline of a round object as the light got dimmer. it was about the size of a dime or a pea. it, probably ridiculously, reminded me of the floating lights in the disney movie tangled. when i could see the outline, the light appeared to be glowing in the center of that small object. i lost sight of it as it got farther off to the south, just before the crest of the hill and the treeline. when it was gone, we tried to discuss what it was but had no words other than ufo.
content.summary: Glowing light went up like a slow firework, turned 90-degrees and flew past me overhead.

content.detailedDescription: Returned home from watching fireworks at my brothers house.I was watching tv. it was approx.11:45.Heard a loud explosion outside.Ran out to see..Looked up to sky and noticed two bright orange fireballs one about 100 feet from each otherthey were moving in the same path. these were nothing i have ever seen before i was shaky they looked like two planes on fire .. i watched them for about 5or so minutes and they just disappeared!.I took pictures and after reviewing the two objects were bars containing three white lightsin a row.
content.summary: Two orange fireballs like planes on fire but round no sound approx. 100 yards apart disapppeared. took photo on cell enhanced to be bar of zizag lights.

content.detailedDescription: On july 4, 2013 at approximately 2220 hours, my girlfriend and i were sitting outside of her house watching the fireworks in our area. we both noticed in the southeast sky a glowing orange object traveling at a high rate of speed. the object continued to travel in a northwesterly direction on a level flight path and when it was some distance from us it ascended at high rate speed and then it would vanish from sight. there was a total of 8 objects observed and they would appear in five minute intervals along the same flight path. these object made no sound and did not display any air craft marker lights. the duration of each sighting lasted approximately five to ten seconds. no video or photographic was attained at the time of the events.
content.summary: Ariel sighting

content.detailedDescription:
While taking video of the neighborhood's fireworks, i noted a light that seemed to be neither a plane (there was one of those and it looked very different), nor a helicopter (i've seen those regularly), nor the fireworks i was trying to tape.  the only way i can describe it is, it looked like one of those chinese lanterns that float up into the air when released, with a flickering candle inside a bag.  i thought that's what it was, and that someone had gotten creative with their particular fourth of july display.  but after a few moments i realized the bag would have to be awfully big to be seen at that distance.  it wasn't that unnerving; in fact the fireworks i'd come out to observe distracted me a couple of times.  but it seemed to drift, only it repeatedly approached the area as if curious about the fireworks, then retreated, using the same apparent "drifting" motion.  from my vantage point, it seemed to be over the nearby hawthorne place apartment complex, more or less; sometimes a little past it.  when i went out later in the evening, after the fireworks were long over (about 1:00 a.M.), the object was long gone as well.  

to be honest with you, i may or may not have had a traumatic encounter with "something" in the past.  there is a "punch biopsy" mark on my right shin just below the knee, which my late parents swore they had never taken me for such a procedure.  (it appeared in childhood.)  in the early 1990's, i began having flashbacks to something, i still don't know what, but whatever it was was frightening.  **the only reason i tell you this is, that's one of the things that was very odd about this "ufo" (if i can use that term) which i'm reporting now.  looking at it, i felt calm, and even thought it was quite beautiful.  with my history, you'd think that if i believed i was looking at a "ufo", i'd be under the bed wetting myself and crying for mommie two minutes later.  but that was not the case.  

i'm reporting only one witness, me, because i didn't talk to the neighbors; they were pretty intent on blowing things up and cheering about it at the time.  besides, i was in my pajamas & wanted to get back inside--and make sure my cats weren't in there popping valiums or anything.  (lol)  

well, thanks for listening.  i hope this info is useful for you in some way.
content.summary: Resembled chinese floating lantern, only much larger.  candle-like flickering light from within.

content.detailedDescription: On july 4, 2013 at approximately 2220 hours, my girlfriend and i were sitting outside of her house watching the fireworks in our area. we both noticed in the southeast sky a glowing orange object traveling at a high rate of speed. the object continued to travel in a northwesterly direction on a level flight path and when it was some distance from us it ascended at high rate speed and then it would vanish from sight. there was a total of 8 objects observed and they would appear in five minute intervals along the same flight path. these object made no sound and did not display any air craft marker lights. the duration of each sighting lasted approximately five to ten seconds. no video or photographic was attained at the time of the events.
content.summary: Ariel sighting
